title: Top Morgan Stanley bankers break down 3 common mistakes startup hedge funds make
description: Hedge fund launches are on the rise, but the fundraising environment is mixed. Morgan Stanley's top prime brokerage execs ...
article_content:
By clicking “Sign Up”, you accept our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy . You can opt-out at any time by visiting our Preferences page or by clicking "unsubscribe" at the bottom of the email.

Access your favorite topics in a personalized feed while you're on the go. download the app

Sign up to get the inside scoop on today’s biggest stories in markets, tech, and business — delivered daily. Read preview

It's shaping up to be a bustling period for new hedge funds. Nearly 150 launches are expected to spin out of larger, $1 billion-plus funds between 2024 and the first half of 2025, according to hedge fund research firm PivotalPath.

But the actual fundraising environment is more complicated. Many of those new launches are being seeded by existing multistrategy giants who have excess capacity to deploy thanks to strong performance — 7.8% annually over the past five years, according to PivotalPath's multistrat index. By comparison, PivotalPath CEO Jon Caplis explained, institutional allocators, constrained by illiquid private investments, have less liquidity to offer right now.

This story is available exclusively to Business Insider subscribers. Become an Insider and start reading now.

That's partially how you explain one of the most anticipated launches in recent years — multistrat Jain Global — falling well short of fundraising expectations, even as overall new launches are up.

Startup funds have allies in investment bank prime brokerage units, a crucial lifeline to hedge funds and a growing business on Wall Street. Prime brokers don't simply finance trades but also serve as a consigliere, especially in the early stages of a fund's life.

Advertisement

Morgan Stanley has long been home to one of the top prime brokerages, and serving hedge funds is key to the bank's equities ambitions. The business has gained renewed focus under new CEO Ted Pick.

Their prime services team, led since 2021 by global coheads Penny Novick and Kim Shaw, caters to established titans but also advises on roughly 50 to 75 hedge fund launches globally each year, depending on the environment. That part of the business is akin to a venture-capital model — work with a broad swath of upstarts to win over the long-term trust and favor of the next D.E. Shaw or Viking Global.

Related stories

Morgan Stanley's prime team helps funds raise capital and finance their operations. They also provide counsel and advice to new managers to improve their odds of success.

While a new launch's viability will ultimately come down to investment performance, there are factors that can trip up an otherwise promising launch — or, if handled shrewdly, set them up for prosperity.

Advertisement

Business Insider recently spoke with Novick and Shaw about the pitfalls they see emerging managers encounter and the advice they prescribe over and over again.

In an environment where institutional investors are becoming increasingly discerning with their capital allocations, nailing the intangibles is critical.

These are 3 of the top stumbling blocks for startup fund managers and how to handle them, according to Novick and Shaw. The responses are in their own words, edited for length and clarity:

It's tempting to cut corners on costs on the non-investment side of the business — don't

Penny Novick:

Some new fund managers at first don't always fully appreciate that getting the non-investment side of the business right is super important. Hiring a strong COO, CFO, and operations people who are well-integrated into the business is crucial for not only the launch but also the long-term success of the business. Additionally, choosing the right systems, vendors, and partners is really going to have a big impact on the ability of that manager to be able to execute on their strategy.

Advertisement

It's similar to when a PM goes to a different platform, and they find that sometimes, even when they're effectively deploying the same strategy, they may be more successful at one firm versus the other. It all comes down to the tools available to them and the support they have around them.

Having strong leadership to run the non-investment side of the business with the requisite expertise and tenure will allow the PM to focus on the portfolio construction and performance without distraction.

Don't go cold on your allocators

Kim Shaw:

New fund managers are meeting with allocators pre-launch to raise capital, but as they transition to focusing on their portfolio, it's easy to cease communication with prospects.

This can be particularly true for firms that enjoy marketing success pre-launch. They raise capital and want to close that chapter, either because PMs believe marketing is a distraction to performance or they assume that successful hedge funds don't need to be proactive. While this may have been true a decade ago, the industry is mature, and there are more funds than capital.

Advertisement

But beyond that, continuing to engage with prospects is simply a sound business strategy. Existing and prospective allocators can be important thought partners. The more they know about a manager and the portfolio, the more willing they are to step up as a source of liquidity.

Hone your story and embrace the tough questions

Penny Novick:

For new founders who haven't been directly involved in speaking to allocators in the past, this can be a different kind of challenge. They need to deliver a digestible, compelling presentation that not only details their investment strategy and process, but also distinguishes themselves from similar existing strategies, such that an allocator can be in a position to bring the opportunity to their investment committee to make the case for adding them to their portfolio.

Our capital introduction team provides our emerging managers with critical advice on what and how to present to investors and gives them opportunities to do practice runs, so that they can work out the kinks and deliver their message succinctly in what can feel like a high-pressure situation.

Particularly in a tough capital-raising environment, it's important to make a compelling business case and address difficult questions in a non-confrontational manner.

Advertisement

Kim Shaw:

Articulating your edge is critical. Describe how your strategy is unique — what are the key differentiators — and substantiate this with data.

title: Global Database Monitoring Software Market 2024 to 2034 Significant Growth Projected at 15.20% CAGR, Reaching USD 10.10 Billion by 2034
description: A Comprehensive Analysis of the Database Monitoring Software Market, Highlighting Key Trends, Growth Drivers, and ...
article_content:
A Comprehensive Analysis of the Database Monitoring Software Market, Highlighting Key Trends, Growth Drivers, and Opportunities Across Components and Major Players

NEWARK, DE / ACCESSWIRE / September 16, 2024 / The global database monitoring software market is set to witness significant growth, projected to expand from USD 2.40 billion in 2024 to an impressive USD 10.10 billion by 2034. The market is expected to register a robust CAGR of 15.20% over the forecast period, driven by increasing demand for real-time database performance analysis and growing reliance on cloud-based database systems.

Understanding the Database Monitoring Software Market:

As businesses continue to migrate their data storage and processing activities to cloud environments, the necessity for effective database monitoring solutions has grown considerably. Enterprises are now investing in advanced software to ensure optimal database performance, minimize downtime, and enhance security.

Rising incidents of database failures and breaches have further propelled the demand for database monitoring solutions, as companies focus on safeguarding their mission-critical data. This demand is particularly strong in sectors such as BFSI, IT & Telecom, healthcare, and retail.

Moreover, technological advancements, including AI-driven predictive analytics, have empowered companies to detect database anomalies early and take proactive measures to mitigate risks, fostering growth in the market.

Drivers and Opportunities:

The database monitoring software market is driven by several key factors, including the increasing adoption of cloud services, the need for better database performance and security, and the growing complexity of enterprise databases. The rise of AI and machine learning-based monitoring tools offers companies the opportunity to optimize their databases in real-time, making significant cost savings and improving operational efficiency.

Opportunities also arise from the increasing regulatory demands for data privacy and protection, which has forced businesses to implement better monitoring solutions. SMEs are expected to contribute to the market's growth as cloud adoption becomes more widespread in smaller enterprises.

Database Monitoring Software Market: Report Scope

Countries CAGR 2024 to 2034 South Korea 18.00% Japan 17.20% The United Kingdom 16.70% China 16.20% The United States 15.60%

Key Takeaways from Database Monitoring Software Market Study:

The global database monitoring software market will expand at a CAGR of 15.20% from 2024 to 2034.

The market is set to grow from USD 2.40 billion in 2024 to USD 10.10 billion by 2034 .

Cloud-based solutions are expected to dominate the market due to increased scalability and cost efficiency.

The rise of AI and machine learning in database monitoring is poised to revolutionize the sector.

Story continues

"The automotive electronics market is benefiting from the broader expansion of the digital economy and the growing emphasis on data-driven decision-making. The increasing reliance on online transactions and the need to ensure the availability, performance, and security of critical data systems are creating a substantial demand for advanced electronic solutions" - Says a Sudip Saha is the managing director and co-founder at Future Market Insights

Component Insights:

The database monitoring software market is segmented into software and services. The software component dominates the market due to the continuous evolution of monitoring tools. However, the service segment is expected to grow at a significant rate, driven by the demand for consultancy, integration, and support services.

Within the software segment, cloud-based solutions are experiencing the fastest growth, as they offer businesses more flexibility and scalability compared to traditional on-premise solutions. In contrast, on-premise solutions are seeing a slower adoption rate due to higher upfront costs and limited scalability.

Key Companies & Market Share Insights:

SolarWinds : A key player with a strong presence in database performance monitoring tools.

Oracle Corporation : Leading the market with its extensive database management solutions.

Microsoft Corporation : Known for its Azure platform, Microsoft has a major share in the cloud database monitoring market.

IBM Corporation and SAP are also significant contributors, especially in the enterprise segment.

Growth Drivers:

Increasing Database Complexity : The rise of hybrid cloud environments and diverse data sources requires businesses to have sophisticated monitoring tools.

Cloud Adoption : As cloud services continue to grow, so does the need for reliable database monitoring solutions that can work across different cloud platforms.

Rising Incidents of Cybersecurity Breaches: As databases become prime targets for cyber-attacks, businesses are increasingly turning to monitoring tools that offer real-time alerts and comprehensive security features.

Market's Prime Determinants of Growth, Trends, and Opportunities:

Cloud-based Solutions : With businesses shifting their databases to cloud environments, cloud-based database monitoring solutions are becoming increasingly vital for ensuring optimal performance and security.

AI & Machine Learning Integration : Monitoring tools powered by AI can detect anomalies early and automate corrective actions, reducing downtime and increasing efficiency.

Growing Complexity in Databases : The increasing complexity of database infrastructures has pushed businesses to adopt advanced monitoring solutions to manage performance, security, and compliance effectively.

Regulatory Demands: Stricter regulations regarding data protection and privacy are compelling businesses to invest in robust database monitoring systems.

Competitive Landscape Overview:

The market is highly competitive, with numerous companies striving for global leadership. Leading firms are increasingly incorporating artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) technologies into their solutions to enhance performance, security, and efficiency. In addition to these innovations, many companies are forming partnerships with database management system (DBMS) providers to offer seamless integration and all-encompassing solutions to customers.

Prominent players in the market include well-established companies like Oracle Corporation, IBM Corporation, Microsoft Corporation, and SAP SE, all of which provide robust database monitoring solutions alongside their DBMS platforms.

At the same time, emerging companies such as Datadog, SolarWinds, and Dynatrace are making waves with their AI-powered monitoring platforms, challenging the dominance of traditional industry leaders.

Recent Developments:

In October 2023, Redgate Software enhanced its SQL Monitor tool by adding support for Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL and on-premises PostgreSQL , offering improved monitoring capabilities for cloud and on-premises environments.

In April 2023, Redgate expanded its SQL Monitor tool by integrating support for SQL Server on Linux , addressing the rising demand for open-source platforms.

In December 2019, SolarWinds acquired VividCortex , a SaaS-based provider of database performance management software, boosting its position in cloud monitoring and application performance management (APM).

In August 2021, Datadog introduced Database Monitoring , which allows engineers to detect and resolve slow query performance, enhancing overall application performance by linking query metrics with infrastructure data.

In October 2019, COPS Monitoring switched to the jBASE monitoring software platform by ZumaSys , resulting in faster query and reporting speeds.

In February 2024, Mozilla Monitor launched Mozilla Monitor Plus, a service designed to remove personal data from data broker sites automatically, addressing privacy concerns and attracting over 10 million users for breach notifications.

title: How to download iOS 18
description: Apple is releasing iOS 18 today. With 250+ new features, this is the next major software update for the iPhone. Here's how to ...
article_content:
Apple is releasing iOS 18 today. With 250+ new features, this is the next major software update for the iPhone, and it comes ahead of the launch of iPhone 16 later this week. Here’s everything you need to know about how to download iOS 18.

Here’s when iOS 18 will be available

Apple said iOS 18 would be available on September 16. If the company follows the trend, this is when you should expect this software update to be available on your iPhone:

10 a.m. PT

1 p.m. ET

Over-the-air updates might take a while, so your device will receive the update anytime between 10 a.m. PT and 10:30 a.m. PT.

iOS 18: Step by step to download the new version

Here’s how to download iOS 18:

Tech. Entertainment. Science. Your inbox. Sign up for the most interesting tech & entertainment news out there. Email: SIGN UP By signing up, I agree to the Terms of Use and have reviewed the Privacy Notice.

On your iPhone, open the Settings app

Tap General, and then Software Update

If you’re not running the latest iOS 17 update, which is iOS 17.6.1, a major prompt will tell you to update to that version; however, at the bottom of the screen, an iOS 18 update option will appear.

If you are running the latest iOS 17 update, a major prompt will ask you to update to iOS 18

What if I can’t download iOS 18?

There are a few reasons why the option to download iOS 18 is unavailable:

You’re running the RC version of iOS 18: If that’s the case, you’re already running the final version of iOS 18

If that’s the case, you’re already running the final version of iOS 18 You’re running iOS 18.1 beta: If you’re on the developer’s beta of iOS 18.1, you can’t download the public iOS 18 version unless you downgrade to this version, which we don’t recommend.

If you’re on the developer’s beta of iOS 18.1, you can’t download the public iOS 18 version unless you downgrade to this version, which we don’t recommend. It does not appear at all: You don’t have a compatible device, or Apple hasn’t released it yet.

Compatible devices

If you want to install iOS 18, you need to know if the update is compatible with your iPhone. These are the devices getting iOS 18 today:

iPhone XR, XS, and XS Max

iPhone 11 Pro and 11 Pro Max

iPhone SE (2nd gen)

iPhone 15 Pro and iPhone 15 Pro Max

Wrap up

Now that you know how to download iOS 18, check out our review, which discusses the most important changes with this software update.
